column6: South}}</ref> aged 245 years) was the seventeenth [[King of Gondor]].

{{disambig-two: Narmacil inherited the Kingship from his father [[Atanatar II
twenty-ninth King, and descendent of Nar: 1226}}.<ref name="South"/>  He also seems to have inherited his father's indolent disposition for in {{TA
column5: n}} he declared [[Minalcar]], the son of his younger brother [[Calmacil (King of Gondor)
column6: Calmacil]], to be the [[Regent of Gondor
column7: Regent of the realm]].  During the remainder of Narmacil's reign Minalcar ruled in his name.<ref name="Gondor">{{App

{{disambig-two: The Easterlings renewed their attacks with a small force, but Minalcar proved to be a vigorous Regent. While Narmacil stayed behind, Minalcar sallied forth in {{TA
the seventeenth King of Gondor: 1248}} and defeated a large army between [[Rhovanion]] and the [[Sea of Rhûn]].  He then took the name of "Rómendacil" (and later would ascend the throne as Rómendacil II). Because he had learned that the [[Northmen]] were not always loyal to [[Gondor]], [[Third Age 1250
twenty-ninth King, and descendent of Nar: soon after]] this victory, Rómendacil sent his son as an ambassador to secure their allegiance.<ref name="Gondor"/>

{{disambig-two: Narmacil ultimately became second childless King of [[Gondor]] and was succeeded by his younger brother [[Calmacil (King of Gondor)
